result.execSummary:
The defendant Chad A. Scipior was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Pay $50 fine + costs + DNA Surcharge for each count. If probation is discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil Judgment will be entered against the Defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Per Wisconsin Statute, funds from prison accounts may be used for obligations in accordance with prison policy not to exceed 25% of gross.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Chad A. Scipior in court with attorney Amy J. Boettcher. Louis J. Molepske appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Amended Information is filed and waived reading. Amended Ct 1 and adds Count 2.
Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement. W/H Sentence:  6 mo Probation: Conditions: Pay $50 + costs = $, Complete a parenting class or provide proof already completed,  Participate in any counseling recommended by the agent. Abide by if a Juvenile Court order of placement and visitation.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of: No Contest to both counts.

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.

ADA Constable makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
State says there has been Victim compliance.
Atty Boettcher concurs with joint recommendation and state there was a juvenile agreement that has been completed now. 


BY THE COURT:  ************PROBATION***************
I/S SEntence: 20 days, for each count, consecutive to each other  jail w/huber for work, counseling or any other purposed allowed by jail- stayed
 6 mo Probation: 
Conditions: Pay $50 + costs+ DNA surcharge each count = $516.00 on each count, 
Complete a parenting class or provide proof already completed - proof provided today and is deemend sastified.,  
Participate in any counseling recommended by the agent.

ADDRESS INFO for Chad A. Scipior

Pre-trial conference on December 22, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Chad A. Scipior in court with attorney Amy Boettcher. Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendants Motion Hearing set for Discovery and Disclosure.

1:30 p.m.  Court calls case.
Atty Constable states the appearances.
Atty Boettcher makes statements indicating that the State has not provided her with requested documentation - recorded interviews of minors.
Court questions who the interviews were done with; Atty Boettcher makes statements on the record.
Atty Constable makes statements regarding the recorded interviews that Atty Boettcher is looking for.
Court questions Atty Constable regarding the release of the recorded interviews; Atty Constable states that she had created an order of which she had requested that Atty Boettcher sign and return.  Court reviews this order.
Atty Boettcher responds to the statements of Atty Constable.
Atty Constable has no further response.

BY THE COURT:
Court will order that the recorded statements be provided to the defense counsel and to be used only for the defense of her client.
Court will order that copies not be provided to the defendant or any others not involved in this case.
Recorded interviews should not be used for any other use than for the judicial proceedings.
Court will not limit who views the recorded interviews as long as it is for the defense of the defendant.
Court will not incorporate paragraph #6 into the proposed order.
Use of these interviews for any other use than what they need to be used for could be held in contempt.
DVD's to be held in the file for the defense attorney and not to be used for any other purpose not related to the defense of the defendant.
DVD's to be provided to Atty Boettcher immediately.
Pre-trial to be scheduled for December 22, 2014 at 8:30 a.m.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for December 22, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on December 1, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Pre-trial conference on December 1, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Comply with any juvenile court order that arises out of this incident.

Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing. 
Court questions defendant regarding waiver of preliminary hearing. 
Court questions Attorney.
Court finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived the preliminary hearing. 
On the defendants waiver of the preliminary hearing, Court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial. 

State files Information.
Defendant received copy of information.
Defendant waives reading of information. 

NOT GUILTY Plea(s) entered.

Atty Cousins recommends a $2,000 signature bond with conditions as stated.
